wizrd 0.1.0

Interact with an Agent

chat.Rd

Interact with an agent, either by a single exchange (predict) or by maintaining context over multiple exchanges (chat).

Methods

There are methods for both predict and chat on Chat and Agent objects.

Usage

Agent

  • chat(x, input = NULL, stream_callback = NULL, system_params = list(), env = parent.frame(), ...)

  • predict(object, input, env = parent.frame(), ...)

Chat

  • chat(x, input = NULL, stream_callback = NULL, ...)

  • predict(object, input, ...)

Arguments

x,object

An Agent or Chat object, which receives the input and generates a response.

input

An object that is sent to the model (appended to the context when x is a Chat object). Typically a string but could also be a raster object (for vision models) or any other R object supported by the extensible serialization mechanism. data.frames are converted to CSV, and other complex objects are serialized to JSON, by default.

stream_callback

A function that takes a single argument, a chunk of the model response, as a string. Typically only used in interactive chat settings, so that responses can be streamed to user as they are being generated.

system_params

When x is an Agent, a named list of strings used to instantiate the system prompt template according to glue semantics. See system_prompt_as. For advanced use only.

env

When x or object is an Agent, an environment that is used when resolving R symbols passed to tools. For advanced use only.

...

For predict, arguments passed to chat. For chat, arguments passed to the underlying backend.

Value

For predict, the model response. For chat, a Chat object.

Author

Michael Lawrence

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
    agent <- llama() |>
        instruct("Answer questions about the mtcars dataset:", mtcars)
    predict(agent, "What is the relationship between hp and fuel efficiency?")
    chat <- chat(agent,
                 "What is the relationship between hp and fuel efficiency?")
    chat <- chat(chat, "Can you suggest ways to visualize this relationship?")
    last_output(chat)
} # }
